extDesc.message: Bookie is a Chrome Extension you can use to create a curated set of bookmarks and associated markdown notes, accessible within the Chrome menubar.

errorMsgGeneric.message: ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Uh-oh! Something went wrong. Download your note to be safe.

introDescOverview.message: Access Bookie via the popoup menu. Bookmarks can be added, removed, oragnized, and notes can be added.

introDescBookmarks.message: Bookmarks can be added easily within the menu, and will automatically populate with info from the current tab (e.g. title and URL).

introDescBookmarksRemove.message: Removing bookmarks can also be handled inline.

introDescBookmarksManage.message: The bookmarks within Bookie are simply Chrome bookmarks stored in a folder called ‚ÄúBookie‚Äù. You can manage the entries for Bookie within the menu itself (via edit and add options) or simply through the native Chrome bookmarks UI.

introDescNotes.message: You can also add notes to accompany each category, these notes are stored within local storage and are only accessible by you. But they will sync across all devices if you're logged into Chrome.

introDescMarkdown.message: Formatting of notes is handled with markdown, simply shift+click on the text box exposes the underlying markdown. Bookie's notes support markdown's syntax as well as some additional custom tags.
